body: Welcome to the second biggest patch of the Forge & Fortune Lifecycle

Combat

  • Heroes now have a combat skill, triggered by reaching Max AP. Description of abilities are available on the hero screen. Heroes skill strength is largely determined by total POW.
  • Combat system has been updated from time-based to round-based.
  • ACT has been replaced by AP Add. Weapon POW is no longer normalized (AKA, the damage you see listed is the damage you deal). AP Add serves a similar purpose to ACT -- the more damage your weapon deals, the less AP it will generate (and thus the less skills your hero will use).
  • There are now three dungeons, each containing unique materials. Dungeon floors are random but pre-determined. Dungeons (and bosses) may lock out certain heroes, making them unable to adventure in that dungeon.
  • Floors reachable are capped at 50 floors per boss kill. For example, to reach floor 51-100 you'd need to beat the first boss. Bosses are unlockable in the Action League and challenged in the adventure screen.
  • Every 50th floor (up until Floor 450) can be converted to a Sanctuary which will heal your heroes upon reaching it. This is purchasable as a Perk in the Action League.

Guilds

  • The worker item contribution system has been replaced by a crafting guild system. There are five craft guilds, each with two major resources each. (Worker screen and worker auto-contribute were also removed as a consequence).
  • Complete guild orders to increase your guild level, unlocking new recipes

• Workers associated with the guild can be leveled up in the guild for gold once unlocked.

    • Action League

    • Tired of just seeing the Action League send you your materials? This is for you

• Hero experience (and levels) have been removed. Instead, completing dungeons awards you with Notoriety.
  • Once the required notoriety thresholds have been reached, Perks will be available for purchase for gold.
  • Perks are a permanent content unlock, such as new heroes, new workers, and permanent bonuses. It's also how new bosses become available.
  • Notoriety is capped based off bosses slayed. Kill more bosses to increase your notoriety caps

Town

  • Town construction has been replaced by a single recipe to be slotted in an action slot (no more nails taking up inventory

)

Recipes

  • Filters are now more prominent at the top of the recipe screen.
  • Recipes are now searchable. Want to know how many recipes contain 'aker' in them? Now it's easy

(Hint: it's three)

User Interface

  • Improvements to almost every facet of the interface have been implemented.
  • Recipes are now shown in card form (to better scale with resolution and provide the content room for future features).
  • New icons are next to most headers to improve sexiness
  • Animations added to make it as smooth as butter
  • Left interface sidebar has been removed to facilitate smaller resolutions (in anticipation of Kongregate port). All information has been moved to the right bar with the exception of workers/materials information -- this is now listed on the recipe screen directly at the very top.
  • Footer bar is 1.2x more clickable, Patch notes are now listed in game, and as new patches come out the game should notify you of it (no more checking discord all the time

)

Settings

  • Battle Log Length: New setting that allows you to set the length of your battle log from 5 entries, up to 999 entries.
  • Toggle HP & AP Bars in Combat Area: Want some extra content space, hide the redundant HP and AP bars in the combat area with this setting.

As always, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for playing our love child and we hope to see you for many patches to come

Make sure to stop by our discord and give us feedback on anything and everything you love or hate.

- Akerson & Friends

May the Lettuce be with you

• Fixed gold display on load (never was missing, just not updated properly)
  • Fixed workers not showing up in guilds after being bought in Action League

• Fixed Abqu Love Letter of notoriety cap not displaying
  • Fixed Flood (& subsequent mobs in the line) to drop correct resource
  • Removed flat function for browser compatibility
  • New patch notifications should work now
Is four patches in one day too much? We think not

• Lowered armor on Boss 1 and Boss 2 to make it less impossible
  • Updated the notoriety cap love letter to be less unclear
  • Removed worker levels -- who needs 'em anyway?

User Interface

  • Changed Guild Order craft button to be more prominent, explicitly mention it's for crafting and be reactive to craftable status (will be green when you can craft, red when you can't)
  • Hero Power now updates immediately after equipping an item

Fixes

  • Fixed typo in Troy's hero ability description
  • Fixed typo in Alok's hero ability description
  • Fixed typo in Grogmar's hero ability description

Features

  • Parties are saved between dungeon adventures and automatically set if you re-enter a dungeon. If a member of the party is unavailable (say for example because they're in another dungeon) this feature won't take effect
  • Material count is shown next to the material on the dungeon screen

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed the bug where enhanced items in guild orders didn't show their "+" number
  • Updated craft button on guild screen to color properly (sometimes)
  • Corrected guild orders requesting multiples of the same item
  • Sort by mastery in recipes now works
  • Titus now correct heals the person with the highest missing HP, not the person with the lowest HP
  • Mail you have open won't disappear when a new piece of mail comes in
  • Fixed building recipes sometimes mysteriously disappearing
  • Removed the last of the worker level references (maybe)
  • Fixed a bug where refreshing the game terminated all parties adventuring rather than progressing them to where they should be

General Improvements

  • Your expanded dropdown preferences are now saved for the "Materials" and "Workers" dropdown in the Recipes screen. By default, Workers will be expanded.
  • Your expanded dropdown preferences are now saved for the "Materials Found In This Dungeon" dropdown for each Dungeon separately.

User Interface

  • Improved display for material amounts in "Materials Found In This Dungeon" dropdown.

New Setting: Reset All Settings

You can now reset your settings including preferences such as expanded dropdowns (like dungeon material dropdowns in adventures). Should your settings ever be corrupted this option can also be used to restore a usable state.

• Reduced crit damage on bosses
  • Fixed bug making guild orders contribute 3x as many points as they should
  • Added AP on recipe cards
  • Updated guilds with descriptions to make it more clear what they do
  • Fixed bug with guild order over-submitting and fixed coloring of craft button once you generate new orders or submit items
• Reduced guild orders required for a level from 5 to 3

• Default to banned on party list rather than "in dungeon"
  • Guilds with progress over the current cap of 3 should "level up"
